topic.title: Zero Circuits
topic.body:
Hello fellow internet pioneers!
How about we create a site for open electronic circuits and other open data. Simple, searchable and easy to use. Like the idea by N-O-D-E https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uWtW9yxVhq4

1541198461_1Kf2cdzcgFuSA2o5X4t9tFMjT4KYK.body:
> [gitcenter](#comment_385_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): There are different networks. But I won't give you any names or links, 'cause we want our users here, on ZeroNet, not on other networks. [...]

^ this. We already have to much. Why not stick to here?

1541269115_1PKq2Vg46orbwHD1pW1hVeArcDskW.body:
Thank you all for your feedback. I would prefer a new minimalistic site. Responsive and simple. But I need help, I can't do the web stuff. I would test the security and could manage the server.
What are you good at peeps?

> [timmo](#comment_3_1QCMg6ZqmUAFd1MGyc2g2j6NDep2GANfAC): Hope you don't mind but I grabbed that Video from YT and re-posted it to KopyKat. [...]

Sounds good! :)
@timmo ZeroWiki isn't very modern and straightforward. I will sketch a few design ideas the next hours and will post them here. Stay tuned :)

This is my first design structure idea: https://www2.pic-upload.de/img/36232903/Projekt.jpg

What do you think?

> [leftside](#comment_321_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): What is that?

It's all about the structure of the website. Do you have any recommendations?

1542317704_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body:
> [thorburn](#comment_10_1Q2noE3qu7ccvEspqWWv4xkMktiqp6mhdK): I just had a thought...would it be possible to create a tool that would pull content from say an existing WPress site or similar and post it into a Znet site? If not automated some simple manual process? [...]

It would be possible. But the problem is the copyright. You will download thousands of terrabyte with conflicting copyright. That would be a disaster
